fi.tuni.bloggingsite

Class BlogController

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.bloggingsite.BlogController

  • public class BlogController
extends java.lang.Object
    Rest Controller that holds mappings related to blog post addresses.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    2019.05.02
    Author:
    Olli Pertovaara

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlogController

        public BlogController()

    • Method Detail

      • getAllBlogPosts

        public <any> getAllBlogPosts()
        Returns all the blog data saved to the H2 database.
        Returns:
        An iterable list of the data as a response entity.

      • getBlogPostData

        public <any> getBlogPostData(java.lang.String blogTitle)
        Gets the data of one blog post if finds one. Returns a response entity containing the data or returns an exception telling the page was not found.
        Parameters:
        blogTitle - The title of the blog post in the url ending.
        Returns:
        A response entity containing a Data object.

      • success

        public ModelAndView success(java.lang.String title)
        Returns a simple success template page after a blog post has been submitted. From there the user can check its content as it appears in the frontend by clicking on a link.
        Parameters:
        title - Path title variable, not used.
        Returns:
        The success.html template.

      • examineTheBlogPost

        public ModelAndView examineTheBlogPost(java.lang.String title,
                                       java.lang.String author,
                                       java.lang.String body,
                                       java.lang.String category)
        Redirects user to blog post after a blog post has been saved to database.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the blog post.
        author - The author's name.
        body - The message body of the blog post.
        category - The category of the blog post.
        Returns:
        A redirection address to frontend.
